content.description: An enticing handcrack goes through the sizes from 0.75 - 3, beginning the first 40 feet. At this point, the crack turns into a committing 2 foot long roof move consisting of chicken wings and super squeezy squeeze chimney. A green big bro/ #6 camalot protects this move super well. This would be... you guessed it... the crux. Rest of the route continues up the widening chimney, ending at the anchor on the right wall. Super exciting and strenuous for a 5.10+, I'd recommend shotgunning a C4 energy drink before leaving the deck. Either way, you have to try this thing!
content.protection: Rap rings at the top on a two bolt anchor
content.location: A large patch of graffiti is a good reference point. From here look right at the obvious handcrack that widens into a "V" up top.
